content.text:
The ElizaOS team has implemented several important updates to their codebase:

1. A new unified hooks system with multi-transport support was added, enabling compatibility across HTTP, SSE, and WebSocket protocols (PR #6300).

2. Two SQL plugin fixes were implemented:
   - Fixed parameterization issues with SQL SET LOCAL commands by using sql.raw() (PR #6316)
   - Added pool configuration, error handling, and fixed PGLite shutdown issues (PR #6323)

3. CI improvements include:
   - Updated permissions to allow the cursor bot to trigger Claude workflows (PR #6328)
   - Upgraded Claude workflows to use Opus 4.5 and added new security and maintenance jobs (PR #6324)

## ElizaOS Ecosystem Overview

Seppmos released a comprehensive video deep-dive on ElizaOS covering the full AI agent stack, Eliza Cloud (for launching your own agents), Babylon (prediction markets for agents), and the revamped $ElizaOS tokenomics. The video is available on both Twitter and YouTube for sharing with friends outside of Crypto Twitter.

## Babylon - AI Prediction Game

Babylon, a fast social prediction game where humans and AI agents react to live events in real time, is close to launch. The platform will allow users to bet on AI agent competitions, creating a colosseum-like environment for AI agents to compete while implementing betting features.

## Developer Updates

- Anthropic API integration requires OpenAI API key for embeddings when using MCP servers
- Core developers are considering turning every plugin into a skill
- New tools like Claude Code Voice Skill allow talking to Claude about projects over the phone
- Nano Banana image generation tool is receiving positive feedback for its impressive results
- The council is implementing monthly/quarterly/annual retrospective discussions

## Open Source Projects

- Oh-My-OpenCode: A battery-included OpenCode plugin with async subagents, curated agents with proper models, and crafted tools
- Claude Code Voice Skill: A skill to talk to Claude about your projects over the phone
- ERC-8004 contracts are being finalized
- Community members are building and sharing their own AI projects, including market-driven emotional states for AI characters

## Community Reminders

- The only official ticket system is through the designated channel
- Users are warned to be cautious of scammers - no team member from ElizaOS will initiate direct messages
- Anthropic keys have been rotated and shared with core developers

The ElizaOS GitHub repository has several open issues related to system functionality and API improvements. These include issues focused on lifecycle management and utilities (#5929), core hooks implementation (#5928), fixing double processing in the messaging API and aligning transports (#6298), and implementing JWT authentication with user management (#6327). These issues represent ongoing development efforts to enhance the ElizaOS platform's functionality and security.

categories.title: Recent Pull Requests in the elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
Three recent pull requests have been submitted to the elizaOS/eliza repository, focusing on SQL plugin improvements and CI workflow upgrades:

1. PR #6329 by 0xbbjoker adds a CachedDatabaseAdapter with LRU caching capabilities to the SQL plugin, enhancing database performance.

2. PR #6323 by wtfsayo fixes several issues in the SQL plugin, including adding pool configuration options, implementing an error handler, and resolving PGLite shutdown problems.

3. PR #6324 by wtfsayo upgrades Claude workflows with Opus 4.5 and introduces new security and maintenance jobs to the CI pipeline.

Between January 5-6, 2026, the elizaos/eliza repository saw significant activity with 5 new pull requests, all of which were successfully merged. Additionally, 2 new issues were opened during this period. The repository maintained an active community with 10 contributors participating during these two days.
sources: text: From 2026-01-05 to 2026-01-06, elizaos/eliza had 5 new PRs (5 merged), 2 new issues, and 10 active contributors.
